newsitem.title: USA: CME live cattle end mixed ahead of USDA report.
newsitem.headline: CME live cattle end mixed ahead of USDA report.

text.p: CME live cattle futures continued to reflect trader evening of positions ahead of the USDA Cattle-on-Feed report and finished weak in deferreds on expectations of heavier fed supplies, traders said.

The monthly cattle report is expected to show feedlot supplies rising to year ago levels. Estimates for November 1 on-feed supplies at the seven primary cattle feeding states averaged 99.5 percent of a year ago with October placements averaging 105.7 percent and marketings averaging 97.3 percent of last year.
The expectations pressured deferred contracts on prospects of increasing cattle supplies while nearby December firmed on short covering, traders said.
Live cattle closed 0.450 higher to 0.200 lower with December up most at 66.975 cents.

December appeared somewhat oversold, especially considering current tight supplies of choice cattle. Although cash fed cattle prices fell $3 per tbf this week, choice numbers remain tight as shown by the large spread of choice beef over select, they said.
Trading was also light in live cattle options early with hedging cited in April.
Traders bought April 64 puts sold 70 calls, pit sources said.
